Jacob’s place was good overall for the time of my stay.
He was not completely honest in his listing about the parking location, which ended up being on the street by the curb along the listed apartment, with him telling me of this on the day of my check in. I also had a bit of trouble trying to check in because the lock instructions were not clear, and had to figure it out in the cold ~30 degree rainy weather.
Upon entrance, there was a noticeable pet smell, dusty air vents, and the couch had pet hair. The bedroom shares a wall and closet with one of the other units, so I never actually felt alone or had any quiet time because everything can be heard, including the pets barking, walking, and yelping just in the room next to yours, so a noise machine would be advisable.
Overall, you get what you paid for. The kitchen was well stocked, and it is a cute, small apartment for a comfortable stay after cleaning it up and getting some noise machines set up.

Honestly, this stay was rough. I think Emma and Vanessa are trying to do something good, and I wanna support that, but a lot of things were bad.
Started with a misdirect in pricing, adding $20 for each guest, a bait & switch I’ve never seen on Airbnb for just a 2nd guest. Continued with the overwhelmingly long house rules they send upon booking, which left us stressed that they were gonna fine us for any issue, and also feeling a bit unsafe wondering who the heck else is staying on the property that has necessitated this diligence. Then the door was unlocked upon arrival— extra unsettling since every light was off. Had to enter the unit and fish for a light switch before we could tell if someone was inside. The place was also freezing cold. All of which had us on edge for the start of the stay.
Also, the rooms are nowhere near as bright and warm as the highly edited photos. The walls are painted very muted cool tones that make the space feel grim, especially at night. The bed and the sofa bed are both covered in a drab white blanket that looks like a motel 6. A book on rape on the bookshelf finishes the depressing vibe.
Lastly, the setup makes for limited functionality. The only table is a narrow bar behind the couch, which leaves two people with anything more than one plate each nervous about knocking food onto the one nice piece of furniture. The TV faces 90 degrees away from said couch and you can’t rotate it. There’s no dishwasher (which I should’ve noticed, but merits mention in the description since that’s rare these days) and the dish drainer in the sink means you’re splashing clean dishes while washing a dirty one.
Just a lot of improvements needed to match what’s presented in pics and make it feel welcoming.
On the positive, the big colorful shower was a nice way to start the day and the front yard of the building is beautiful.

This is a great rental! I stayed here with my spouse and parents while we were in town to visit my daughter and her family. The proximity to Birmingham allowed us to enjoy some attractions, but we were able to retreat to the cozy house at the end of the day. You immediately feel at home when you come in to the unit. The open floor plan allows for everyone talk while you are in the kitchen and living room areas. The fireplace added warmth and charm to the space. If you are looking to cook, the kitchen has everything you would need. The bedrooms were spacious and had very nice linens. The beds were very comfortable too.
I know we will book this unit again. The owner was very responsive and helpful, even leaving lights on for our evening check in. If you are looking for a place to stay in Gardendale, this is it!
